intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium picoalbense, commonly known as the white-haired hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are yellowish-green, blooming in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in meadows and rocky slopes.
